Legal_Issue: Whether the judicial review application can proceed without meeting procedural requirements
Governing_Law: Section 18.1 of the Federal Court Act
Royal Canadian Mounted Police Act s. 5, 22(1)
Application_Facts: Applicants claim RCMP improperly refuses meal allowances; grievances are unresolved; Commissioner's jurisdiction not yet invoked due to incomplete grievance process
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of denied meal allowances
Court_Ruling: Application dismissed due to procedural non-compliance and unexercised Commissioner jurisdiction
Defendant_Behavior: RCMP alleged to have improper guidelines and failure to act on meal allowance claims
Grounds_for_Claim: Improper denial of meal allowances, lack of Commissioner action
Legal_Standard: Compliance with Federal Court Rules and exhaustion of statutory grievance procedures
Assessment_Factor: Completion of internal grievance process, jurisdictional prerequisites
Procedural_Issue: Failure to meet procedural requirements under Rule 1602; incomplete grievance process
Application_Basis: Alleged improper refusal of meal allowances by RCMP
Relief_Sought: Judicial review of decision denying meal allowances
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to exhaust grievance process before seeking judicial review
Outcome: Dismissal of application with costs awarded against respondents
Cause_Description: Applicants sought judicial review over denied meal allowances, alleging improper guidelines and lack of Commissioner action
Jurisdictional_Issue: Commissioner's jurisdiction not yet invoked due to incomplete grievance process
Decision_Rationale: Application does not comply with procedural rules; statutory grievance process not exhausted
Legal_Standard_Applied: Procedural compliance under Federal Court Rules and exhaustion of administrative remedies
